oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military order from head of Nashville & North Western Railroad
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From Brig. Gen. William D. Whipple, this order from the Dept. of the Cumberland headquarters authorizes the military railroad "to take such trees, timber or wood, along and within a half a mile of the Railroad lines as are necessary...It is desirable that the timber growing within half a mile of the N. & N. W. Railroad should be cut away, that it may no longer afford cover to guerillas and bushwhackers."
